Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo.User

Class UserPlane

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.image.ImageView
com.example.demo.LevelCommonElements.Actor.ActiveActor
com.example.demo.LevelCommonElements.Actor.ActiveActorDestructible
com.example.demo.LevelCommonElements.Actor.FighterPlane
com.example.demo.User.UserPlane
All Implemented Interfaces:
Destructible, javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
public class UserPlane extends FighterPlane
Represents the user-controlled plane in the game. This class extends the FighterPlane class and handles the movement, shooting projectiles, and managing the user's shield during the game.

The plane's movement is controlled by the player through keyboard inputs (up/down). The user can also activate a shield by pressing the Enter key. Additionally, the plane can shoot projectiles and keeps track of the number of enemies it has destroyed.

See Also:
  • FighterPlane
  • UserShield

  • Constructor Details

    • UserPlane

      public UserPlane(int initialHealth)
      Constructs a new UserPlane object with the given initial health. Initializes the plane's image, position, and shield. The plane can be controlled by the player through keyboard input, and the shield can be toggled with the Enter key.
      Parameters:
      initialHealth - the initial health of the user plane

  • Method Details

    • handleKeyPress

      void handleKeyPress(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
      Handles key press events. Specifically, toggles the shield's activation when the Enter key is pressed.
      Parameters:
      event - the key event triggered by the player

    • updatePosition

      public void updatePosition()
      Updates the position of the user plane by moving vertically and ensuring that it stays within the specified vertical bounds. It also updates the position of the shield if it is active.
      Specified by:
      updatePosition in class ActiveActorDestructible

    • updateActor

      public void updateActor()
      Updates the plane's state and position. This is a required method in the game's update cycle.
      Specified by:
      updateActor in class ActiveActorDestructible

    • fireProjectile

      public ActiveActorDestructible fireProjectile()
      Fires a projectile from the user plane. The projectile is created at the specified x and y coordinates relative to the plane.
      Specified by:
      fireProjectile in class FighterPlane
      Returns:
      a new UserProjectile object representing the fired projectile

    • isMoving

      private boolean isMoving()
      Checks if the user plane is currently moving.
      Returns:
      true if the plane is moving (i.e., the velocity multiplier is non-zero), false otherwise

    • moveUp

      public void moveUp()
      Moves the plane upward by setting the velocity multiplier to -1.

    • moveDown

      public void moveDown()
      Moves the plane downward by setting the velocity multiplier to 1.

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stops the movement of the plane by setting the velocity multiplier to 0.

    • getNumberOfKills

      public int getNumberOfKills()
      Returns the number of kills the user has achieved.
      Returns:
      the number of kills

    • incrementKillCount

      public void incrementKillCount()
      Increments the number of kills by one.

    • addShieldToScene

      public void addShieldToScene(javafx.scene.Group root)
      Adds the user's shield to the game scene.
      Parameters:
      root - the root node of the scene to which the shield will be added

    • setShieldAllowed

      public void setShieldAllowed(boolean allowed)
      Sets whether the shield is allowed to be active or not.
      Parameters:
      allowed - true if the shield should be allowed, false otherwise

    • updateShieldPosition

      public void updateShieldPosition()
      Updates the position of the shield, ensuring that it follows the user plane.

    • isShieldAllowed

      public boolean isShieldAllowed()
      Checks if the shield is currently allowed to be active.
      Returns:
      true if the shield is allowed, false otherwise
